distribute

public Money[] distribute(int installments)
Allocate this money amount in n installments. All money is divided. If the devision remainder is not zero it is added to the first amount

Parameters:
percentages - an int arrays containing the percentages. Example int[]{30,30,40}
installments - the quantity of required installments
Returns:
an arrays of Money each of the same currency as this and containing the percentage of the amount

distribute

public Money[] distribute(int installments,
                          int incrementedInstallment)
Allocate this money amount in determinate number of installments. All money is distributed. If the devision remainder is not zero it is added to the informed installment

Parameters:
installments - the number of instalments to distribute into.
incrementedInstallment - The instalment to increment. 1 is the first, 2 is the second, etc...
Returns:
an arrays of Money each of the same currency as this and containing the percentage of the amount

allocate

public Money[] allocate(int... percentages)
Allocate this money amount according to a percentage distribution All money is divided. If the devision remainder is not zero it is distributed among the first installments

Parameters:
percentages - an variable array of int, each representing a percentages. allocate(30,30,40). The sum must be 100
Returns:
an arrays of Money each of the same currency as this and containing the percentage of the amount
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if percentages is empty or it does not sum 100.

divide

public Money divide(int n)
Divides the amount equally between n installments So 100 divided by 3 will return 33,33 for a 2 fraction digits currency

Parameters:
n - number of installments
Returns:
the operation result Money
See Also:
#divideAndRemainder(int,int)

divideAndRemainder

public Money[] divideAndRemainder(int n)
Divides the amount equally between n installments returning the quotient and rest of that division.

Parameters:
n - number of installments
Returns:
the operation result Money
See Also:
divide(int), BigInteger.divideAndRemainder(java.math.BigInteger);
